rules.title: Game Rules
rules.description1: Y is a board game for two players in which participants take turns placing pieces of their color on a triangular board made up of hexagonal spaces.
rules.description2: The objective of the game is to connect the three sides of the board with a continuous chain of pieces, and the first player to achieve this wins the game.
rules.description3: The basic rules are very simple: each player places a piece of their color on an empty space during their turn, without moving or removing already placed pieces.
rules.description4: The corners of the board count as belonging to the two adjacent sides, for example, a piece at the tip of the triangle belongs to both its left and right sides.
